import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react' import { Form, Link, useParams } from 'react-router-dom' import { useDispatch, useSelector } from 'react-redux' /* Imported useParams to replace "params" and "match" */ import { Row, Col, Image, ListGroup, Card, Button } from 'react-bootstrap' import {Rating} from '../components/Rating' import {Loader} from '../components/Loader' import {Message} from '../components/Message' import { listProductDetails } from '../actions/productActions' const ProductScreen = () => { // const ProductScreen = ({ match }) => { // const product = products.find((p) => p._id === match.params.id)} // Version 6 of react-router-dom no longer uses the match prop // Use the following link if you have this problem again with react-router-dom version 5 incompatibility // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70290770/react-typeerror-cannot-read-properties-of-undefined-reading-params const { id } = useParams(); console.log(id) const idString = toString(id) // const product = products.find((p) => String(p._id) === id) // const [product, setProduct] = useState({}) // DON'T NEED THIS const [qty, setQty] = useState(0) const dispatch = useDispatch() const productDetails = useSelector(state => state.productDetails) const { loading, error, product } = productDetails useEffect(() => { dispatch(listProductDetails(id)) }, [dispatch, id]) return ( <> Go Back {loading ? : error ? {error} :(

{product.name}

 Price: ${product.price} Description: {product.description} Price: ${product.price} Status: {product.countInStock > 0 ? 'In Stock' : 'Out Of Stock'} {product.countInStock > 0 && ( Qty setQty(e.target.value) } > {[...Array(product.countInStock).keys()].map((x) => ( ))} )} )} ) } export default ProductScreen
